verses.verse: Better <WH2896> is a dry<WH2720> morsel<WH6595>, and quietness<WH7962> therewith<WH1004>, Than a house full<WH4392> of feasting<WH2077> with strife<WH7379>.

A servant<WH5650> that dealeth wisely<WH7919> shall have rule<WH4910> over a son<WH1121> that causeth shame<WH954>, And shall have part<WH2505> in the inheritance<WH5159> among<WH8432> the brethren<WH251>.
The refining pot<WH4715> is for silver<WH3701>, and the furnace<WH3564> for gold<WH2091>; But Jehovah<WH3068> trieth<WH974> the hearts<WH3826>.
An evil-doer<WH7489> giveth heed<WH7181> to wicked<WH205> lips<WH8193>; And a liar<WH8267> giveth ear<WH238> to a mischievous<WH1942> tongue<WH3956>.
Whoso mocketh<WH3932> the poor<WH7326> reproacheth<WH2778> his Maker<WH6213>; And he that is glad<WH8056> at calamity<WH343> shall not be unpunished<WH5352>.
Children <WH1121>'s children<WH1121> are the crown<WH5850> of old men<WH2205>; And the glory<WH8597> of children<WH1121> are their fathers<WH1>.
Excellent <WH3499> speech<WH8193> becometh<WH5000> not a fool<WH5036>; Much less do lying<WH8267> lips<WH8193> a prince<WH5081>.
A bribe<WH7810> is as a precious<WH2580> stone<WH68> in the eyes<WH5869> of him that hath<WH1167> it<WH6437>; Whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth<WH7919>.
He that covereth<WH3680> a transgression<WH6588> seeketh<WH1245> love<WH160>; But he that harpeth<WH8138> on a matter<WH1697> separateth<WH6504> chief friends<WH441>.
A rebuke<WH1606> entereth<WH5181> deeper into one<WH995> that hath understanding Than a hundred<WH3967> stripes<WH5221> into a fool<WH3684>.
An evil<WH7451> man seeketh<WH1245> only rebellion<WH4805>; Therefore a cruel<WH394> messenger<WH4397> shall be sent against him<WH7971>.
Let a bear<WH1677> robbed<WH7909> of her whelps meet<WH6298> a man<WH376>, Rather than<WH408> a fool<WH3684> in his folly<WH200>.
Whoso rewardeth<WH7725> evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896>, Evil<WH7451> shall not depart<WH4185> from his house<WH1004>.
The beginning<WH7225> of strife<WH4066> is as when one letteth out<WH6362> water<WH4325>: Therefore leave off<WH5203> contention<WH7379>, before<WH6440> there is quarrelling<WH1566>.
He that justifieth<WH6663> the wicked<WH7563>, and he that condemneth<WH7561> the righteous<WH6662>, Both<WH8147> of them alike are an abomination<WH8441> to Jehovah<WH3068>.
Wherefore is there a price<WH4242> in the hand<WH3027> of a fool<WH3684> to buy<WH7069> wisdom<WH2451>, Seeing he hath no understanding<WH3820>?
A friend<WH7453> loveth<WH157> at all times<WH6256>; And a brother<WH251> is born<WH3205> for adversity<WH6869>.
A man<WH120> void<WH2638> of understanding<WH3820> striketh<WH8628> hands<WH3709>, And becometh<WH6148> surety<WH6161> in the presence<WH6440> of his neighbor<WH7453>.
He loveth<WH157> transgression<WH6588> that loveth<WH157> strife<WH4683>: He that raiseth high<WH1361> his gate<WH6607> seeketh<WH1245> destruction<WH7667>.
He that hath a wayward<WH6141> heart<WH3820> findeth<WH4672> no good<WH2896>; And he that hath a perverse<WH2015> tongue<WH3956> falleth<WH5307> into mischief<WH7451>.
He that begetteth<WH3205> a fool<WH3684> doeth it to his sorrow<WH8424>; And the father<WH1> of a fool<WH5036> hath no joy<WH8055>.
A cheerful<WH8056> heart<WH3820> is a good<WH3190> medicine<WH1456>; But a broken<WH5218> spirit<WH7307> drieth<WH3001> up the bones<WH1634>.
A wicked<WH7563> man receiveth<WH3947> a bribe<WH7810> out of the bosom<WH2436>, To pervert<WH5186> the ways<WH734> of justice<WH4941>.
Wisdom <WH2451> is before the face of him that hath understanding<WH6440>; But the eyes<WH5869> of a fool<WH3684> are in the ends<WH7097> of the earth<WH776>.
A foolish<WH3684> son<WH1121> is a grief<WH3708> to his father<WH1>, And bitterness<WH4470> to her that bare him<WH3205>.
Also to punish<WH6064> the righteous<WH6662> is not good<WH2896>, Nor to smite<WH5221> the noble<WH5081> for their uprightness<WH3476>.
He that spareth<WH2820> his words<WH561> hath<WH3045> knowledge<WH1847>; And he that is of a cool<WH3368> spirit<WH7307> is a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394>.
Even a fool<WH191>, when he holdeth his peace<WH2790>, is counted<WH2803> wise<WH2450>; When he shutteth<WH331> his lips<WH8193>, he is esteemed as prudent<WH995>.
